# XML Documents and Data

> Parsing, writing, and manipulating XML in .NET using `System.Xml` namespaces. Core types include `XmlReader`/`XmlWriter` for streaming, `XmlDocument` for DOM manipulation, `XPathNavigator` for XPath queries, and `XslCompiledTransform` for XSLT transformations. `System.Xml.Schema` provides XML Schema (XSD) validation. For modern XML programming, prefer LINQ to XML (`System.Xml.Linq`) with `XDocument` and `XElement`.

*Topics available: 111*

- [Accessing Attributes in the DOM](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/data/xml/accessing-attributes-in-the-dom.md): Learn more about: Accessing Attributes in the DOM
- [Accessing Strongly Typed XML Data Using XPathNavigator](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/data/xml/accessing-strongly-typed-xml-data-using-xpathnavigator.md): Learn more about: Accessing Strongly Typed XML Data Using XPathNavigator

XPath queries know of namespaces in an XML document & can use namespace prefixes to qualify element & attribute names.
